metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28856 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: Redis is an open source, in-memory database that persists on disk.Authenticated users can use the `HINCRBYFLOAT` command to create an invalidhash field that will crash Redis on access in affected versions. This issuehas been addressed in in versions 7.0.11, 6.2.12, and 6.0.19. Users areadvised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this issue.

criterions.comment: redis: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
